dmTitle.infoName: Default business rules exchange data module

levelledPara.title: Degasser
levelledPara.para: The degasser (PHS-280B) is a pressurized vessel used to out gas the recycle loop gas from the liquid product. The degasser has an enclosed volume of approximately four gallons. The liquid product enters at the top of the unit and its operation is keyed to the collector cycle. When the bucket dumps, the degasser is filled with about 0.37 gallons of liquid product. The internal pressure of the degasser rises due to the out gassing of the recycle loop gas from the liquid product as well as the head change due to the added liquid product. Valve integrity is checked, the gas is vented to the oxidizers dropping pressure in the degasser, and the degassed liquid is then piped to sanitary tank #3.

The degasser also contains an independent level switch (LS-1243B) which is used to prevent recycle loop gases from entering sanitary tank #3 even if there is a failure of the control system. This sensor is an optical sensor type and its signal is used by the ISM board to interlock the degasser drain solenoid valve (SV-281B) shut if the degasser is dry. The system also provides an on-screen indication of the sensor status.
